straph.utils package¶

Module contents¶

straph.utils.dataframe_to_latex_landscape(df, latex_output_path, title=None, highlight_best_result=False)[source]¶

Take a pandas DataFrame and output a latex table. Requirements : latex, pdflatex :param df: A Pandas DataFrame (of a reasonable size, nb of columns). :param latex_output_path: Path to write the corresponding LaTeX table. :param title: Title of the output LaTeX table. :return:

straph.utils.get_cmap(N, cmap='hsv')[source]¶

Returns a function that maps each index in 0, 1, … N-1 to a distinct RGB color.

straph.utils.plot_adjacency_list(S, a_l, label=True)[source]¶

Plot the current adjacency list a_l.

Parameters:
  • S – A stream graph (we get its labels)
  • a_l – an adjacency list
Returns:

Plot of adjacency list
straph.utils.profile_function(sf, snakeviz=False)[source]¶

Profile a function passed as a string sf using CProfile. The result can be visualise with snakeviz (option). :param sf: string correspoding to a function call (example : profile_function(“do_thing(foo,bar)”,snakeviz=True).) :param snakeviz: Use snakevize to visualise results of CProfile (a web page will open). :return:
